content.question: The equilibrium quantity of labor used in the production of a good will be the largest under which of the following conditions?

choices.label: When the labor market is monopsonistic and the output market is perfectly competitive
When the labor market is monopsonistic and the output market is a pure monopoly
When the labor market is perfectly competitive and the output market is a pure monopoly
When both the labor and output markets are perfectly competitive
When laborers are allowed to collude in setting a price

content.answer: When both the labor and output markets are perfectly competitive
